entry.title: High-Speed Internet for Every Community: Oregon Invests Federal BEAD Funding Statewide
entry.summary: Oregon will achieve 100% broadband-access coverage with 19 awardees, 317 projects and 212 district grant areas Oregon is investing the $689 million federal Broadband Equity, Access, and Deployment (BEAD) award to expand affordable, high-speed, and reliable internet service to thousands of unserved and underserved residents. The application window closed on Wednesday, August 6, 2025, with… The post High-Speed Internet for Every Community: Oregon Invests Federal BEAD Funding Statewide appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Fiscal year 2025 among best for SOU philanthropy
entry.summary: (Ashland, Ore.) — Southern Oregon University continued its historic fundraising run in fiscal year 2025, raising $14.17 million. The philanthropic total for FY25 is the second-highest annual total ever raised for the university; in fiscal year 2023, the university raised more than $19 million, including $10 million from Lithia Motors and Green Cars. “We’re generating… The post Fiscal year 2025 among best for SOU philanthropy appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Three new members appointed to SOU board
entry.summary: (Ashland, Ore.) — A local credit union president and CEO with extensive public service experience, a Southern Oregon University alumna and administrator, and a student in the SOU Master’s in Business Administration program have been appointed by Oregon Gov. Tina Kotek and confirmed today by the Oregon Senate to serve on the Southern Oregon University Board… The post Three new members appointed to SOU board appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: SOU board chair receives highest Chamber honor
entry.summary: SOU Board of Trustees Chair Sheila Clough was honored for her volunteerism and community service in a surprise presentation of the Honorary Life Member Award at last week’s 115th annual dinner of the Ashland Chamber of Commerce. The award is the highest honor that the Ashland Chamber bestows on individuals. “Through her vision, her dedication and… The post SOU board chair receives highest Chamber honor appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Dynamics of Team Development
entry.summary: Some of the toughest issues business owners deal with are with transitioning from a sole proprietor form to a fully functional organization with employees working in defined areas of responsibility, all working together to deliver services and products to willing customers. The volume of information available to entrepreneurs is incredibly large, and although considerable effort… The post Dynamics of Team Development appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: The Need to Effectively Manage Employee Benefits Across International Borders
entry.summary: By Jon Neidermeyer International expansion is a business strategy that U.S. organizations – including Oregon’s – may be holding back on these days given an uncertain economy that’s aggravated by trade wars. Yet even through the pain of tariffs and deepening trends like reshoring, businesses still need to protect and bolster the investments they have made and… The post The Need to Effectively Manage Employee Benefits Across International Borders appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Roseburg High Walkout Draws National Attention
entry.summary: A student walkout at Roseburg High over transgender locker room access has gained national attention, with major outlets and social media accounts sharing the story. Supporters praised the protest while critics called it discriminatory, highlighting ongoing debates about privacy and gender identity.

entry.title: Douglas County fire season ends today: tips for safe debris burning
entry.summary: The Douglas Forest Protective Association (DFPA) officially ended the 2025 fire season on today, according to DFPA officials, noting that recent rains and cooler temperatures have reduced fire risks in the area.

entry.title: BB Gun Discovery Triggers Brief Security Measure at Roseburg High School
entry.summary: Roseburg High School briefly entered a “Secure” status after a BB gun was found near campus Friday afternoon. Police confirmed there was no credible threat, but students were kept inside as a precaution amid ongoing protests. The situation was resolved and classes dismissed as scheduled.

entry.title: Fire Season Officially Ends in Douglas County - 2025
entry.summary: DFPA officially ended the 2025 fire season on Oct. 10 at 9:01 a.m. after recent rain and cooler weather. Restrictions are lifted, but caution is urged when burning debris. Logging slash still requires a permit, and some private or public lands may maintain fire restrictions.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Faces Multiple Charges After Two-Day Crime Spree and Jail Outburst
entry.summary: Jeremy Brett Vroman, 48, faces multiple felony charges after allegedly committing two crimes in one day, including a daycare burglary and breaking a home’s window. He appeared via video from jail after refusing to attend his arraignment and has declined a court-appointed attorney.

entry.title: Students Walk Out at Roseburg High Over Locker Room Access Debate
entry.summary: Students at Roseburg High walked out Wednesday during eighth period to protest transgender students using locker rooms matching their gender identity. Counter-protesters also attended, calling the demonstration transphobic. Oregon law allows students to use facilities by gender identity.

entry.title: Heat Lamp Blamed for Dixonville House Fire; Kitten Rescued
entry.summary: Firefighters responded to a house fire Tuesday morning on Buckhorn Road in Dixonville. Flames were coming from several windows, and one kitten was rescued. The blaze started from a heat lamp used to warm baby chickens, officials said. No injuries were reported.

entry.title: [National News] Florida Man Arrested for Arson in Deadly Palisades Fire That Killed 12
entry.summary: A Florida man has been arrested for allegedly starting the blaze that became January’s deadly Palisades Fire in Los Angeles, which killed 12 and destroyed thousands of homes. Officials say 29-year-old Jonathan Rinderknecht first set a smaller fire that later reignited amid strong winds.

entry.title: RHS students and parents hold walkout over transgender rights
entry.summary: “No boys in girls’ locker rooms.” “Trans rights are women’s rights.” “Girls deserve privacy too.” “Protect trans kids.” “My privacy is important too.” “Honk if you support trans rights.” “This all ends when enough of us say no.”

entry.title: Spearheaders Leather Goods Opens New Storefront in Downtown Roseburg
entry.summary: Spearheaders Leather Goods is opening its new storefront in Roseburg on Oct. 11. Owned by local craftsman Dan Spencer, the shop features handmade belts, wallets, and bags. The grand opening runs 2–6 p.m. at 1614 NE Vine St, Suite 102, with vendors, displays, and in-store specials.

entry.title: Major Drug Arrest in Roseburg Nets Fentanyl and Methamphetamine
entry.summary: A Roseburg man was arrested after deputies found 48.3 grams of fentanyl and 11 grams of meth. Detectives say 47-year-old Clinton Reed admitted to planning a fentanyl sale. He faces multiple charges for unlawful delivery and possession of controlled substances.
